title: The cost of Trump’s attack on American science

summary: Sweeping funding cuts in the US are posing a significant threat to the innovation sector, which has been a key driver of the country's economic strength for decades. These cuts could potentially weaken the nation's position in global economic competitiveness by impacting research, development, and technological advancements.

title: What would a US tariff on chips look like?
snippets: A component levy on foreign-made semiconductors would function as a major tax increase on electronics sold in America
titles: What would a US tariff on chips look like?
summary: A proposed component levy on imported semiconductors is set to act as a significant tax hike on electronic goods sold in the United States. This measure would impact the cost of electronics by increasing the price of foreign-made semiconductors, which are essential components in a wide range of electronic devices.

title: Mining Stocks Still Have Room To Rise as Gold Hits Record High, Jefferies Says
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • The price of gold hit a fresh record high Tuesday, briefly crossing $3,500 per ounce.
  • Jefferies analysts said Tuesday shares of companies that mine the precious metal could still have room to rise. 
  • The analysts raised their price targets for some mining stocks such as Agnico Eagle and Newmont ahead of the companies' earnings reports this week. 


As gold prices keep hitting record highs, Jefferies analysts said shares of companies that mine the precious metal could still have room to rise.

The price of gold briefly crossed $3,500 per ounce Tuesday, setting a record for the second day in a row. At $3,387 per ounce in recent trading, the precious metal has risen nearly 30% so far in 2025. Gold is “the only true safe haven left,” Jefferies analysts told clients Tuesday, amid worries about a U.S. trade war with China and President Donald Trump’s recent comments attacking Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell. 

However, gold mining stocks haven’t all caught up to the rally, Jefferies said. The current prices of mining stocks would suggest a gold price of about $2,500 per ounce, the analysts said, well below the current level. The analysts pointed to Barrick Gold (GOLD) as a possible “catch-up” candidate, and raised their price targets for several other miners including Agnico Eagle (AEM) and Alamos Gold (AGI).

Bank of America Also Boosts Stock Targets for Gold Miners

Meanwhile, Bank of America Securities lifted its targets for Barrick, Agnico, and Alamos, along with Newmont (NEM), whose shares have jumped nearly 50% this year.

Newmont is due to report first-quarter earnings Wednesday, with Agnico expected a day later. Alamos and Barrick are set to follow on April 30 and May 7, respectively.
titles: Mining Stocks Still Have Room To Rise as Gold Hits Record High, Jefferies Says
summary: Gold prices reached a new record high, crossing $3,500 per ounce, driven by concerns over a U.S. trade war with China and comments by President Donald Trump. Despite this surge, shares of gold mining companies have not fully reflected the increase, with current stock prices indicating a gold value of around $2,500 per ounce. Analysts from Jefferies and Bank of America Securities have raised their price targets for several mining stocks, including Agnico Eagle, Newmont, Alamos Gold, and Barrick Gold, ahead of their upcoming earnings reports.

title: One-third of Lower Thames Crossing budget spent on planning documents
snippets: More than £450mn used for obtaining permission for road tunnel scheme
titles: One-third of Lower Thames Crossing budget spent on planning documents
summary: The UK government has spent over £450 million to secure permission for a road tunnel project. This expenditure covers the costs associated with the planning and approval processes necessary to move forward with the construction of the tunnel.

title: Robot see, robot do: System learns after watching how-to videos
snippets: Researchers have developed a new robotic framework powered by artificial intelligence -- called RHyME (Retrieval for Hybrid Imitation under Mismatched Execution) -- that allows robots to learn tasks by watching a single how-to video.
titles: Robot see, robot do: System learns after watching how-to videos
constructiveness_reason: This story clearly highlights an innovation in the field of robotics, contributing to readers' understanding of the topic.
summary: Researchers have created RHyME, an artificial intelligence-driven robotic framework, enabling robots to learn tasks from watching just one instructional video. This development marks a significant step in robotic learning, showcasing the potential for robots to acquire new skills efficiently through visual observation.

title: Oil cleanup agents do not impede natural biodegradation
snippets: Biodegradation is an important natural process during oil spill cleanup. A new study revealed that using spill treating agents does not negatively impact naturally occurring biodegradation.
titles: Oil cleanup agents do not impede natural biodegradation
constructiveness_reason: This story provides empowering knowledge about oil cleanup methods, contributing to readers' understanding of environmental conservation.
summary: A recent study has found that the use of spill treating agents in oil spill cleanup efforts does not hinder the natural process of biodegradation. This discovery supports the effectiveness of these agents in managing oil spills without compromising the essential natural breakdown of oil by microorganisms.

title: LHC breaks the record for heaviest antimatter nucleus ever seen
snippets: Researchers at the Large Hadron Collider found evidence of an unprecedentedly heavy and exotic form of antimatter in the aftermath of a collision between extremely fast lead ions
titles: LHC breaks the record for heaviest antimatter nucleus ever seen
summary: Researchers at the Large Hadron Collider have discovered evidence of a new, extremely heavy form of antimatter. This finding came after analyzing the results of collisions between high-speed lead ions. This breakthrough adds significant knowledge to our understanding of antimatter and its properties.

title: We can build quantum computers using the rules of special relativity
snippets: Machine learning helped show how harnessing the weird effects of Einstein’s special relativity could enable a new kind of quantum computer – and it could also lead to new insights into the quantum realm
titles: We can build quantum computers using the rules of special relativity
summary: Machine learning has demonstrated that utilizing the phenomena of Einstein's special relativity could facilitate the development of a novel quantum computer. This approach may also offer fresh perspectives into the quantum realm, suggesting potential advancements in quantum computing technology and understanding.

title: Range expansion in lesser goldfinches
snippets: New research shows that Lesser Goldfinches, a small songbird traditionally found in Southwest USA, are expanding their range northward through the Pacific Northwest at an unprecedented rate, providing insights into how species adapt to environmental change.
titles: Range expansion in lesser goldfinches
summary: Recent research has found that Lesser Goldfinches, small songbirds native to the Southwest USA, are rapidly expanding their range northward into the Pacific Northwest. This expansion is significant for understanding how species adapt to environmental changes.
